SENT.plain: A 44 year old man complained of a left flank pain
After two hours he suddenly experienced severe back pain, lower limb numbness and weakness of the legs
The physical examination revealed the flaccid paraplegia and the disturbance of pain and touch sensation
But his proprioceptive sensation was preserved
The paraplegia gradually disappeared and he had no neurological deficit
Judging from the unique sensory disturbance, the anterior spinal artery syndrome was suspected
